intro: Tetragonia sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in cooking. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its botanical features include a prostrate or upright growth habit, depending on environmental conditions.
